page.title: 18NEWCOMERS' VIEW OF DALRY
page.content: We are an elderly couple, who came to Dalry from London two years ago, due to family changes. Our immediate impression was of the friendly and helpful attitude of the local people. We found banking, mortgage facilities and legal services readily available. Medical and optical attention has been good. General groceries are available in the town centre and the more intimate "Corner Shop" is always ready to obtain unstocked items. The Episcopalian Church serves our religious needs and the older residents are not forgotten in town celebrations. The main thing we miss is Common Land as we came originally from Forest Land where we enjoyed the open spaces. However, to compensate, we have the sea not far away and farmland around.
